#Text=Do Bargaining in a Market for the First Time
#Text=Bargaining is a practice .
#Text=You get better the more you do it .
#Text=For some , bargaining can be stressful but for others they find such practice exciting .
#Text=It all depends on how you look at such practice , painful or fun , it is all up to you .

#Text=Whether you are hassling for a furniture or a piece of cloth is a market ( especially in a different country ) , bargaining should be practice and here 's how to bargain for those who have never done it before .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Be Fearless .
#Text=Do n't be afraid to bargain .
#Text=With bargaining , you ca n't be shy or timid especially scared .
#Text=Vendors can sense this kind of feelings and to your disadvantage , they will prey on you without mercy .
#Text=Vendors are vultures and their goal is just that , to make money .
#Text=Walk around .
#Text=Take your Time .
#Text=When you aim to get a good buy , you must carry a hand full of time .
#Text=Bargaining takes time and you ca n't rush deals .
#Text=If you plan to go to a market and seriously buy things at a low cost , you have to make your whole day available .
#Text=Learn as you go .
#Text=Always walk with an open eye .
#Text=Most vendors in a market will carry almost the same product .
#Text=After you spent your time walking around and making a feel of the market ... then it 's time to test the market .

#Text=If you see a duplicate of things , asked one vendor for a price , then always make an unsatisfied face like its " too much " face then right away say , " thank you , I 'm just looking around " and leave ! You can then estimate the given price and use it to the second vendor who is selling the same product .
#Text=Understand the Situation .
#Text=Study your target .
#Text=If you spot a vendor that targets your liking , first you have to take a couple of things in mind .
#Text=Is the vendor busy with other customer ?
#Text=Is there other associates that could assist you ?
#Text=Understanding this kind of things is crucial because you do n't want to go to a vendors place when they are busy or with customers .
#Text=They will only give you a little bit of their attention and when they do , they wo n't have patience for you and your bargaining .
#Text=Make a Bargain .
#Text=A Sequence-
#Text=When you are ready to buy , prepare to spend time in there .
#Text=Between 15-30
#Text=Minutes is your estimated time .
#Text=Do not rush the buy , do n't stress the buy , and do n't settle right away .

#Text=Making your bargain is a sequence , you ask the price , you make an unsatisfied face , you hear the vendors side , you stall , you asked for the lowest price , you make an unsatisfied face again , you hear the vendors side , you make a comparison to the other vendors , you stall ... then you " pretend " to walk away .
#Text=If you walk away , 99 % of the time the vendor will call you back in .
#Text=Accept negative reaction .
#Text=Unpleasant reaction is possible .
#Text=When bargaining and really doing good in it , chances are your vendor will be utterly despise you .
#Text=Who would n't ?
#Text=Your craft got you away from being taken advantage of .
#Text=You must not feel bad when your vendor shows a negative reaction .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Most vendors have a calculator on hand to put their price , bring your own calculator so at the end of the bargaining shenanigans you can put YOUR price .
#Text=In a begging of bargaining , the vendor will ask you how much you would pay for a product , do not give in a price right away .
#Text=Never show the vendor that you WANT the product .
#Text=Never show a character of want- be neutral on the product .
#Text=Do n't be afraid to walk away if you do n't want to pay for the asking price .
#Text=Be ready to encounter negative remarks- but remain cool
